Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the extent to which the media ignored the coronavirus during press events in May.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or examples to support the assertion that the media never asked about the coronavirus during press events in May.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for why the media did not ask about the coronavirus during press events in May, such as the focus on other news stories like the protests following George Floyd's killing.
Falters at times: The claim may falter in accurately representing the media coverage of the coronavirus during press events in May, as there is evidence that reporters did ask questions about COVID-19 during that time.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there were reporters who asked Governor DeSantis about the coronavirus during press conferences in May.
